packsack.util

Class ByteStringManipulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • packsack.util.ByteStringManipulator

  • public class ByteStringManipulator
extends Object
    Class used to convert strings, bytes and integers.
    Author:
    sebserge

      Convert a byte to a string of length 8.

        public String padBinaryStringWithZerosAtEnd(String stringToPad)
        Pad String with zeros so it is divisible with 8.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • byteToString

        public String byteToString(int c)
        Convert a byte to a string of length 8. Add 256 to pad the start with zeros
        Parameters:
        c - int/char to convert to a string
        Returns:
        substring 1-9, 8 bit string for the int/char

      • toUnsignedInt

        public int toUnsignedInt(int value)
        Convert Java signed integer to unsigned, due to bytes are signed in Java
        Parameters:
        value - the value to change to unsigned
        Returns:
        unsigned integer

      • stringToByte

        public byte stringToByte(String toByte)
        Convert a String with length of 8 to a byte.
        Parameters:
        toByte - the string to convert
        Returns:
        byte of the binary string

      • fileSizeToBytes

        public byte[] fileSizeToBytes(int size)
        Convert the file size from integer to an array of 4 bytes using bit shifting.
        Parameters:
        size - the length of file
        Returns:
        array of 4 bytes

      • convertTreeBinaryStringToBytes

        public byte[] convertTreeBinaryStringToBytes(String treeAsBinary)
        Converts the treeAsBinary String to an array of bytes to write in the output stream. Makes sure the string is divisible with 8 and with substring(0, 8) cut the string to 8-bits/byte.
        Parameters:
        treeAsBinary - Tree as binary string
        Returns:
        array of bytes
